title: S rating rewards
body: After you get M7 on a champion there is no incentive to keep up the same effort put in to get S(-,+). There should be hextech rewards for further your effort. Since chests are such a big problem, why don't we get pieces of a chest? Or more blue essense? etc.

replies.body:
im lvl 7 shaco and i love playing my lvl 7 shaco

i love Qing into the near dead enemy, mastery taunting (BEFORE REVEALING MYSELF), and then killing them


I absolutely adore making my enemies tilt because I'm a lvl 7 shaco

The point of lvl 7 isn't for a reward, it's to demoralize the opposition
so you play ur m7 not to do well but to bm the enemy team? ok

why you gotta put it like that :'( ?

i still do well most of the time <.<

its also cus im a otp but i left that part out

>chests
that sure is a funny way of spelling key fragments
I have Mastery 7 because I do well on my champion. I didn't try to play harder to get it, I played my hardest, and got it because of that.

You should always be playing either decently and/or to have fun. You shouldn't NEED incentive to keep you playing your best other than a sticker saying "You were playing your best, and your best was good enough"

The whole point of the mastery system is to encourage skill on a champion you're learning. Once you get to Mastery Seven, the system acknowledges that you're at least competent to consistently attain S ranks. After that, the incentive is playing the champion and showing off how well you know and play that champion.
The incentive to play harder is to do a ranked game. I don't need a reward to try harder in a ranked game. You should be doing that in the first place.

You have a good point but

"why don't we get pieces of a chest?"

Make it coupons, otherwise League's hextech crafting will become greece.
whatever it may be, I just think getting the highest rating should reward the player
